Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred by not providing a separate analysis under section 97 of IRPA
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to inconsistent testimonies and documentation
Evidence_Type: Testimony, documentary evidence, lack of recent persecution evidence
Basis_of_Claim: Political persecution as members of UDPS
Evaluation_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution (s. 96), Risk of torture or cruel treatment (s. 97)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible and consistent evidence supporting the claim
Application_Error: Alleged failure to conduct separate s. 97 analysis
Review_Outcome: No error found; RPD's decision upheld
Evidence_Ignored: No distinct evidence presented regarding risk under s. 97
Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applied in judicial review
Application_Factor: Credibility issues affecting both s. 96 and s. 97 claims
Decision_Review_Issue: Omission of separate s. 97 analysis after negative credibility finding
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 97 of IRPA requires independent analysis only if there is distinct evidentiary basis
Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent testimony and lack of credible evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony and lack of corroborating evidence
Procedural_Fairness: No breach found; RPD followed proper procedures
Credibility_Issues: Significant inconsistencies in applicants' statements and documents
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that RPD should have conducted separate s. 97 analysis
Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural error in omitting s. 97 analysis
Omission_Type: Failure to provide separate analysis under s. 97
